full_text:
Patient is a 67-year-old Caucasian male with muscle-invasive bladder cancer (MIBC), stage III (pT3aN0M0). Presented with gross hematuria in 08/2023. TURBT on 09/01/2023 confirmed high-grade urothelial carcinoma with muscularis propria invasion.

Underwent radical cystectomy with ileal conduit on 11/15/2023 after 4 cycles neoadjuvant gemcitabine/cisplatin. Path: ypT2N0, partial response to chemotherapy.

Current meds: Oxybutynin PRN, Vitamin B12 monthly injection, Omeprazole 20mg daily.

Labs (01/10/2024): Creatinine 1.4, GFR 52, Hgb 11.2, WBC 5.8, Platelets 234.

ECOG PS: 1

HBsAg neg, HCV neg. PMH: HTN, 40 pack-year smoking history (quit 2020). No prior malignancies.

Signatera (01/15/2024): Negative

Surveillance initiated. Adapting well to ileal conduit.

73-year-old Asian female with non-muscle invasive bladder cancer (NMIBC), high-grade Ta. Recurrent disease after BCG induction and maintenance.

TURBT 12/2023 showed HG Ta papillary urothelial carcinoma. CIS also present on random biopsies. BCG-unresponsive disease.

Discussing radical cystectomy vs bladder-sparing approaches (pembrolizumab, nadofaragene).

Meds: None cancer-related.

Labs (01/25/2024): Creatinine 0.9, GFR 68, UA with microscopic hematuria.

ECOG PS: 0

No hepatitis. PMH: Osteoporosis, hypothyroidism. Never smoker.

Referred to medical oncology for systemic therapy options. Patient prefers bladder preservation if oncologically appropriate.

58-year-old Caucasian male with metastatic urothelial carcinoma. Primary bladder tumor with retroperitoneal and mediastinal lymph node metastases at diagnosis.

Received first-line gemcitabine/cisplatin x 6 cycles with partial response. Maintained on avelumab maintenance since 07/2023.

Recent imaging shows stable disease at 6-month scan.

Meds: Avelumab q2weeks, Prednisone 5mg PRN for infusion reactions, Ondansetron PRN.

Labs (02/01/2024): Creatinine 1.2, TSH 2.4, Hgb 12.0, WBC 6.2, LFTs normal.

ECOG PS: 1

No hepatitis. PMH: Gout, hyperlipidemia. 25 pack-year smoking history.

Tolerating avelumab well. No immune-related adverse events to date. Continue maintenance.

64-year-old African American female with muscle-invasive bladder cancer, clinical stage II (cT2N0M0). Diagnosed after evaluation of recurrent UTIs and hematuria.

TURBT 01/2024 showed high-grade urothelial carcinoma with detrusor muscle invasion. CT chest/abd/pelvis negative for metastatic disease.

Cisplatin-eligible. Planning neoadjuvant gem/cis followed by radical cystectomy.

Meds: Metformin 1000mg BID, Lisinopril 10mg daily.

Labs (01/28/2024): Creatinine 0.95, GFR 72, Hgb 11.8, A1c 7.0.

ECOG PS: 0

HBsAg neg, HCV neg. PMH: Type 2 diabetes, HTN, obesity (BMI 32). Never smoker.

Audiogram baseline completed. Starting chemotherapy next week.

71-year-old Caucasian male with cisplatin-ineligible metastatic urothelial carcinoma due to CKD (GFR 38). Liver metastases present at diagnosis.

Started on carboplatin/gemcitabine, completed 6 cycles with stable disease. Now on avelumab maintenance.

Progressed on maintenance at 4-month mark with new lung nodules.

Starting second-line enfortumab vedotin.

Meds: New - Enfortumab vedotin, continuing prior meds for comorbidities.

Labs (02/15/2024): Creatinine 1.8, GFR 36, Hgb 10.2, Glucose 145, HbA1c 6.8.

ECOG PS: 1

No hepatitis. PMH: CKD stage 3b, diabetes, peripheral neuropathy (grade 1).

Monitoring closely for EV-associated toxicities including neuropathy and skin reactions.

55-year-old Hispanic male with upper tract urothelial carcinoma (UTUC) of left renal pelvis. High-grade, pT2N0M0 after nephroureterectomy 10/2023.

Path: High-grade urothelial carcinoma, 3.5cm, invading muscularis, margins negative. No LVI. 0/8 nodes.

Adjuvant nivolumab recommended given high-risk features.

Meds: Nivolumab q4weeks (started 12/2023), Omeprazole.

Labs (02/10/2024): Creatinine 1.3 (baseline with single kidney), TSH 3.8, LFTs normal.

ECOG PS: 0

No hepatitis. PMH: Kidney stones (multiple episodes). 30 pack-year smoking history.

Tolerating adjuvant immunotherapy well. Continue for planned 1 year course.

79-year-old Caucasian female with localized MIBC, clinical stage II. Significant cardiac history precludes surgery.

Planned for trimodality bladder preservation: maximal TURBT followed by concurrent chemoradiation.

TURBT achieved visible complete resection. Starting radiation with radiosensitizing chemotherapy.

Meds: Aspirin 81mg, Metoprolol 50mg BID, Atorvastatin 40mg, Furosemide 40mg.

Labs (02/20/2024): Creatinine 1.1, BNP 245, Hgb 11.5.

ECOG PS: 2

No hepatitis. PMH: CHF (EF 40%), CAD s/p CABG 2018, atrial fibrillation, CKD stage 3a.

Cardiology clearance obtained for chemoradiation. Using single-agent cisplatin at reduced dose for radiosensitization.

62-year-old Asian male with variant histology bladder cancer - micropapillary urothelial carcinoma. Stage III (pT3bN1M0) at presentation.

Underwent radical cystectomy with extended lymphadenectomy 09/2023. 3/24 nodes positive.

Completed adjuvant gem/cis x 4 cycles. Tolerated well.

Meds: Vitamin supplements, Omeprazole.

Labs (01/30/2024): Creatinine 1.1, GFR 65, CBC normal.

ECOG PS: 1

No hepatitis. PMH: GERD, BPH. Former smoker (quit 15 years ago).

Signatera (02/05/2024): Positive (1.2 MTM/mL)

Concerning for microscopic residual disease. Discussing options including additional systemic therapy vs close surveillance with imaging.

45-year-old Caucasian female with rare small cell carcinoma of bladder, limited stage. Presented with locally advanced disease (cT4N1M0) with pelvic sidewall involvement.

Treating with platinum-etoposide (EP) chemotherapy per small cell protocols. Completed 4 of planned 6 cycles.

Imaging shows good partial response. Consolidative radiation planned.

Meds: EP regimen, Ondansetron, Dexamethasone, Filgrastim.

Labs (02/18/2024): WBC 2.8, ANC 1.2, Hgb 10.0, Platelets 112, Creatinine 0.9.

ECOG PS: 1

No hepatitis. PMH: Anxiety, migraines. 15 pack-year smoking history.

Tolerating therapy with expected cytopenias. Growth factor support ongoing.

69-year-old Caucasian male status post radical cystectomy for MIBC in 2022. Now with oligometastatic recurrence - single pulmonary nodule confirmed as metastatic urothelial carcinoma on biopsy.

Thoracic surgery evaluation: amenable to metastasectomy.

Plan: Systemic therapy followed by surgical consolidation.

Starting gem/cis with plan for pulmonary metastasectomy if good response.

Meds: Starting chemotherapy.

Labs (02/25/2024): Creatinine 1.3, GFR 55, Hgb 13.2, LFTs normal.

ECOG PS: 0

No hepatitis. PMH: Former MIBC, HTN, BPH. 45 pack-year smoking history (quit at diagnosis).

Multidisciplinary discussion favors aggressive approach given long disease-free interval and limited metastatic burden.

76-year-old Hispanic female with recurrent NMIBC (HG T1) refractory to BCG. Cystectomy recommended but patient refuses.

Enrolled in clinical trial for intravesical gene therapy (nadofaragene firadenovec).

Completed induction course. 3-month cystoscopy shows complete response.

Meds: None related to cancer.

Labs (02/28/2024): Creatinine 1.0, UA negative.

ECOG PS: 1

No hepatitis. PMH: Atrial fibrillation on anticoagulation, COPD, osteoarthritis.

Continuing with maintenance intravesical therapy per protocol. Close cystoscopic surveillance ongoing.

52-year-old African American male with muscle-invasive bladder cancer and synchronous prostate cancer. Bladder: cT2N0M0 high-grade UC. Prostate: Gleason 3+4, intermediate risk.

Multidisciplinary discussion regarding optimal management. Plan for radical cystoprostatectomy after neoadjuvant chemotherapy for bladder cancer.

Completed neoadjuvant gem/cis. Restaging shows stable disease.

Meds: Tamsulosin 0.4mg, completed chemotherapy.

Labs (02/20/2024): Creatinine 1.0, PSA 8.2, Hgb 12.5.

ECOG PS: 0

No hepatitis. PMH: BPH, hyperlipidemia. Former smoker.

Scheduled for radical cystoprostatectomy with extended lymphadenectomy next month.

68-year-old Caucasian female with pure squamous cell carcinoma of bladder, rare histology. Locally advanced (cT3bN2M0) at presentation.

Received neoadjuvant platinum-based chemotherapy with partial response.

Underwent anterior pelvic exenteration 01/2024. Path: ypT3aN1, 2/18 nodes positive.

Recovering from surgery. Discussing role of adjuvant therapy.

Meds: Pain management, stool softeners, DVT prophylaxis.

Labs (02/15/2024): Creatinine 1.2, Hgb 9.8, Albumin 3.0.

ECOG PS: 2 (post-operative)

No hepatitis. PMH: Chronic schistosomiasis (acquired during travel), recurrent UTIs.

SCC of bladder associated with chronic irritation. Wound healing well. Oncology follow-up scheduled.

60-year-old Asian male with FGFR3-altered metastatic urothelial carcinoma. Progressed on first-line gem/cis and second-line pembrolizumab.

FGFR3 fusion detected on comprehensive genomic profiling.

Started erdafitinib 8mg daily. Tolerating with expected hyperphosphatemia.

Meds: Erdafitinib 8mg, Sevelamer for phosphorus control, Artificial tears for dry eyes.

Labs (02/22/2024): Creatinine 1.3, Phosphorus 5.8 (on binders), Hgb 10.8.

ECOG PS: 1

No hepatitis. PMH: Hyperlipidemia. Never smoker.

CT at 8 weeks shows partial response. Managing toxicities. Continue erdafitinib with close monitoring.

74-year-old Caucasian male with widely metastatic urothelial carcinoma (liver, bone, lung). Poor performance status at presentation.

Cisplatin-ineligible due to PS and renal function. Started on atezolizumab single agent (PD-L1 high).

Disease progression after 3 months. Transitioned to best supportive care per patient wishes.

Meds: Comfort-focused - pain management, antiemetics, anxiolytics.

Labs (02/28/2024): Creatinine 2.1, Hgb 8.5, Albumin 2.4, LFTs elevated.

ECOG PS: 3

No hepatitis. PMH: COPD, CHF, 60 pack-year smoking history.

Goals of care: comfort-focused. Hospice referral completed. Family meeting held.

57-year-old Caucasian female with MIBC, status post neoadjuvant chemotherapy and radical cystectomy with orthotopic neobladder 08/2023. Path showed complete response (ypT0N0).

Adapting to neobladder function. Some stress incontinence, improving with pelvic floor PT.

Meds: Oxybutynin ER 10mg, Vitamin B12, Probiotics.

Labs (01/25/2024): Creatinine 1.0, B12 normal (on supplementation), electrolytes normal.

ECOG PS: 1

No hepatitis. PMH: Anxiety, IBS. 20 pack-year smoking history (quit 2 years ago).

Signatera (02/01/2024): Negative

Excellent pathologic response. Surveillance ongoing. Working with urology on continence optimization.

81-year-old Caucasian male with NMIBC (HG Ta) managed conservatively due to advanced age and comorbidities. Multiple TURBTs over past 5 years.

Recent TURBT 02/2024 showed stable HG Ta, no progression to T1 or CIS.

Declined BCG due to prior intolerance. Managed with surveillance and repeat TURBTs.

Meds: Multiple for cardiac and pulmonary conditions.

Labs (02/25/2024): Creatinine 1.5, GFR 42, Hgb 10.8.

ECOG PS: 2

No hepatitis. PMH: CAD, CHF, COPD, atrial fibrillation, CKD stage 3b.

Acknowledged risk of progression but patient prefers bladder preservation with close surveillance. Family in agreement.

49-year-old Hispanic female with occupational bladder cancer (aromatic amine exposure in dye industry). Stage I (pT1N0M0) high-grade urothelial carcinoma.

Underwent TURBT with re-TURBT showing no residual disease. Completed BCG induction.

Meds: None cancer-related.

Labs (02/10/2024): All within normal limits.

ECOG PS: 0

No hepatitis. PMH: Migraine headaches. Never smoker. Occupational exposure history documented.

Starting BCG maintenance. Workers compensation claim filed. Close surveillance with cystoscopy q3 months for first 2 years.

66-year-old African American male with muscle-invasive bladder cancer with plasmacytoid variant features. Known aggressive histology. Stage IIIA (pT3aN0M0) at cystectomy.

Received perioperative chemotherapy (neoadjuvant + adjuvant). Completed 09/2023.

Developed peritoneal carcinomatosis at 4-month follow-up. Started palliative chemotherapy.

Meds: FOLFOX (different regimen due to prior platinum exposure), supportive care.

Labs (02/20/2024): CEA 15, Hgb 10.2, Creatinine 1.4.

ECOG PS: 1

No hepatitis. PMH: HTN, hyperlipidemia. 35 pack-year smoking history.

Discussing goals of care given aggressive disease biology and early recurrence.

72-year-old Asian female with incidentally discovered bladder mass during workup for unrelated issue. TURBT showed low-grade Ta papillary urothelial carcinoma.

Low-risk NMIBC. Single intravesical chemotherapy (MMC) given post-operatively.

Meds: None cancer-related.

Labs: All normal.

ECOG PS: 0

No hepatitis. PMH: Hypothyroidism, osteoporosis. Never smoker.

Surveillance cystoscopy at 3 months showed no recurrence. Continuing yearly surveillance per guidelines for low-grade Ta.
